Points I definitely want to make:
* some animal sounds are more consistent (cat), some are more variable (pig)
* some sounds look different when written, but actually share sounds
* highlight each of the sound colors

In the following examples, phonemes are grouped by colors to show their phonetic similarity. For instance, [m] and [n] are both nasals and serve a very similar purpose as the start of the cat sound (e.g. “meow”), so they are grouped by color as a visual aid.
